III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 hit Youth A in the face after Youth A hit him.
Investigation Interviews:
I attempted to contact Complainant on 5/2/25 and 5/5/25.
Complainant did not return phone calls.
All interviews were conducted with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A was interviewed on 5/2/25 at the facility. She reported on
5/1/25 she was told by a staff that she would be moving units.
Youth A reported she was upset by this news. Youth A reported
she was in the hallway outside of her unit when she received this
information and began kicking the walls around her. Youth A
reported she kicked the walls, broke the walls, and then picked up
the drywall pieces and threw at staff or attempted to hit them with
the drywall. Youth A reported she punched Staff 1 and then he
punched her back in the face. Youth A reported Staff 1 and
Supervisor 2 placed her in a restraint, but she dropped to ground,
resulting in both staff releasing her from the restraint. Youth A
reported there were other staff around, but they didn’t see
anything. Youth A reported the other staff were Staff 2 and Staff 3.
When Youth A was asked to explain the events in greater detail,
she stated she “blacked out” and could not remember anymore.
Youth A reported she did not have any scratches on her face or
marks from Staff 1. Youth A reported she saw the nurse after the
restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 5/21/25. Staff 1 reported
he came in for his afternoon shift around 3:00pm. Youth A was
upset and in the hallway. She was kicking the walls, causing the
drywall to break. Staff 1 reported Youth A picked up the drywall
pieces and was threw them at staff and attempted to hit staff with
the pieces. Staff 1 reported they were substantial sizes. Staff 1
reported because of the damage to the walls and the removal of
the drywall, pipes and electrical wires were exposed. Youth A
continued to kick at these items, and it was then decided to place
her in a restraint. Staff 1 reported Staff 3, Staff 5, and Staff 4 were
in the hallway. Staff 3 and Staff 1 attempted to place Youth A in a
CPI high hold. This was described as two staff, one on each side,
2

tucking her elbows to her body to stop movement from Youth A.
Because Youth A was aggressively fighting this, the hold did not
work, and she was released. Youth A began to kick and throw
drywall again. Youth A then targeted Staff 1 and began coming
after him with drywall in her hand and threatening him. Staff 1 and
Staff 5 placed her in a two man hold and again could not maintain
this due to her physical aggression. Staff 1 described her
aggression as spitting, punching and yelling. Staff 1 reported he
attempted to move away from her and was backing away due to
now being the target of her aggression. Youth A began to throw
punches at him and a staff (unknown) placed themselves in the
middle of these punches to block them. Staff 1 was backing away
from her and was able to remove himself from the hallway. Staff 1
reported he never punched her or hit her in anyway. Staff 1 did not
see if she had any scratches on her.
Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Supervisor 2 were interviewed
separately via telephone with MDHHS Worker on 5/29/25. Staff 5
was interviewed via telephone on 6/23/25. Each staff reported
they were involved in the situation on 5/2/25 with Youth A. All
reported Youth A was physically aggressive and kicking the walls.
All reported Youth A was using the drywall as a weapon against
staff. All reported the holes in the wall exposed piping and
electrical wires; therefore, a restraint was attempted but never fully
completed. None of the staff reported the attempted restraint was
done outside of CPI. All the staff reported Youth A was the
aggressor and Staff 1 never punched or hurt Youth A. All staff
reported they did not see any scratches or marks on Youth A due
to the restraint.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone with MDHHS Worker
on 5/29/25. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was aggressively
attacking Staff 1 by “throwing punches” and drywall. Supervisor 1
reported the attempted restraints were done well, they were just
unable to maintain the positions due to Youth A’s aggressive
nature. Supervisor 1 reported there were no marks or scratches
on Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 did not hit or punch
Youth A.
Video Observation:
Video was dated 5/1/25 from 3:22:53-3:24:01pm. Youth A is
visibly kicking the wall and removing drywall from the wall. She is
seen throwing the drywall at staff and holes are exposed in the
wall. Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempt to restraint and Youth A
immediately becomes aggressive and pushes through the staff
3

and is released from the hold. Youth A is seen punching and
swinging her arms at Staff 1. Staff 1 is moving backwards.
Another restraint is attempted by Staff 1 and Staff 5. At 3:23:28,
Staff 1 and Staff 5 have Youth A in a Standing High Hold, but she
maneuvered out of this hold at 3:23:49. Youth A continued to
attack Staff 1. Multiple staff attempted to block her from hitting
Staff 1, by trying to hold her back. Staff 1 is seen backing away
from Youth A with his arms extended, while Youth A is physically
attacking him. Staff 1 obtains enough physical distance from
Youth A to leave the hallway. At 3:24:01 Youth A sits on the
ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• I reviewed the incident report dated 5/1/25. The report is in
agreement with the verbal interviews noted. Youth A was
seen by the nurse and was given her inhaler and an ice
pack for her head. No marks were noted.
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Central registry was
completed on 3/18/24. CPI was completed on 1/14/2025.
Staff 1 does not have disciplinary action that is applicable
to this allegation.
• I reviewed the Behavior Management Policy. The policy
outlines CPI as an acceptable intervention. It also outlines
interventions that are prohibited.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Video observation as well
as interviews with staff reveal Youth A was the aggressor in the
situation and no staff involved physically attacked Youth A. All
staff involved did well securing the hallway and following the CPI
interventions. Staff 1, when he realized he had turned into the
target of Youth A, removed himself from the situation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
